Title.evidence: The study was not a randomised controlled trial

Trial_Design.evidence: The study was not a randomised controlled trial

Participants.evidence: Eligibility criteria included no previous bleeding disorders and consent to warfarin therapy.

Intervention.evidence: The study was not a randomised controlled trial

Objective.evidence: This study aimed to evaluate the role of the SAMe-TT2R2 score in predicting anticoagulation control after mechanical mitral valve replacement.

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was Time in Therapeutic Range (TTR) ≥65%, measured over a median follow-up of 1,749 days.

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: The study was not a randomised controlled trial

Blinding.evidence: The study was not a randomised controlled trial

Number_Randomised.evidence: The study was not a randomised controlled trial

Number_Analysed.evidence: The study was not a randomised controlled trial

Result_Outcome.evidence: For a cut-off score of ≥4, sensitivity and specificity for predicting TTR ≥65% were 69.8% and 93.1%, respectively.

Trial_Registration.evidence: no trial registration or funding information is available

Funding.evidence: no trial registration or funding information is available
